page.title: 19TRADE IN CURDWORTH AREA
page.content: THIS IS LARGELY AN AGRICULTURAL AREA WITH RELATIVELY SMALL RESIDENTIAL SECTORS. IT ENJOYS THE PROXIMITY OF LARGE URBAN AREAS WITHIN EASY REACH, WHERE CONSUMERS MAY BUY CONVENIENTLY AND OFTEN MORE CHEAPLY, OVER A WIDE RANGE OF GOODS AND SERVICES. TRADE IN CURDWORTH THEREFORE TENDS TO EXIST IN TERMS OF SMALL LOCAL SERVICES AND A SHOP SELLING ESSENTIAL HOUSEHOLD GOODS TO A CASUAL DEMAND RATHER THAN IN BULK. THE POST OFFICE GENERAL STORE THEREFORE PROSPERS AND IS A FOCAL POINT IN THE VILLAGE. THE LOCAL GARAGE AUGMENTS ITS TURNOVER BY SELLING ANGLING EQUIPMENT AND VEGETABLE PRODUCE, SOME LOCALLY PRODUCED. MOBILE SALESMEN SELLING FISH, POULTRY AND DAIRY PRODUCE VISIT REGULARLY. THE HYPERMARKET WITHIN TEN MINUTES BY ROAD RENDERS ADDITIONAL RETAIL GOODS. CURDWORTH STILL RETAINS VILLAGE SMITHY
